description: Direct Solution (DE4) Solver Package - Solves the finite-difference equations using a banded Gaussian elimination algorithm

variables.name: COMMENT
variables.description: Optional comment lines at beginning of file.
variables.tooltip: Lines starting with '#' are treated as comments and ignored by MODFLOW.

variables.name: ITMX
variables.description: Maximum number of outer iterations per time step.
variables.tooltip: Maximum outer iterations. For linear problems (all confined), 1 is sufficient. For nonlinear problems, use 10-50.

variables.name: MXUP
variables.description: Maximum number of equations in the upper part of the equations to be solved.
variables.tooltip: Typically set to 0 to let MODFLOW compute automatically. Used for memory allocation.

variables.name: MXLOW
variables.description: Maximum number of equations in the lower part of the equations to be solved.
variables.tooltip: Typically set to 0 to let MODFLOW compute automatically. Used for memory allocation.

variables.name: MXBW
variables.description: Maximum bandwidth of the lower part of the equations.
variables.tooltip: Typically set to 0 to let MODFLOW compute automatically. Bandwidth depends on grid dimensions.

variables.name: IFREQ
variables.description: Frequency of matrix reconstruction. 1=every iteration, 2=every time step, 3=only when needed.
variables.tooltip: 1=reconstruct equations every outer iteration. 2=reconstruct each time step (saves time for linear problems). 3=reconstruct only at start or when time step size changes.

variables.name: MUTD4
variables.description: Printout flag. 0=print convergence summary, 1=print convergence iteration details, 2=no printing.
variables.tooltip: Controls solver output to listing file. 0=summary each time step. 1=detailed iteration info. 2=silent.

variables.name: ACCL
variables.description: Multiplier for computed head change (acceleration parameter). Usually 1.0.
variables.tooltip: Head change multiplier. 1.0 is standard. Values > 1.0 can over-relax (accelerate). Values < 1.0 under-relax (stabilize).

variables.name: HCLOSE
variables.tooltip: Outer iterations converge when the maximum absolute head change is less than HCLOSE. Typical: 0.001 to 0.01.

variables.name: IPRD4
variables.description: Time step interval for printing convergence data when MUTD4=0 or 1.
variables.tooltip: Convergence information is printed every IPRD4 time steps. 1=every time step.
